Reviews.Title: “Rick Steves is WRONG The "Family Room" is disgusting”
Reviews.Author: Alyssa M
Reviews.Content: FYI for any fans of Rick Steves . . . DO NOT book the "family room" at the Jubilee Hotel under any circumstance - well maybe it's a step up from sleeping on the steps of one of the nearby churches, but other than that there is just about anything better. I am not a germaphobe by any means, but this hotel was gross. The bathroom was moldy and filthy - reminded me more of Mexico than London. I didn't even brush my teeth in there - used a glass and bottled water instead! Stayed out as late as possible and left first thing in the morning. Found a cuter, cleaner place in a better location just a few streets west in Belgravia - no more expensive either. What a dump! Also the man on the phone hardly spoke English and couldn't give us walking directions from Victoria Station so we wandered quite a while in the cold looking for the place. Not run by locals and they weren't friendly at all. Breakfast was minimal - cold cereal, tea and toast. And they do want you to leave your key everytime you leave. Just a terrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible stay”
Reviews.Author: Chalupa12
Reviews.Content: We booked a double room with shared bathroom. The three rooms that share a bathroom are in the basement of the renovated townhouse. The room we were in had yellow walls that were covered in foot scuff, dirt and ?food particles, also there was a kettle provided for tea, but I don't know what the heck was growing in there. There were two beds, a double and a single, neither of which had sheets large enough to fit the bed. My husband and I attempted to sleep on the double bed, but the matress was so dis-shaped I felt like I was upside-down and my husband could only be tilted into the center of the mattress, thus I spent my night in the single bed. There is a window with a few to nowhere, well technically its a wall, and no curtains either, and wonderful at night when the light that is lighing the sign for the hotel shines right into the room too! :(The bathroom can only be descirbed as deplorable. There was mold (green and black) growning on almost every surface except the sink and the toilet. The staff were friendly enough. The street noise is loud. The location is great as it is a half-hour walk to Westminster abbey and a 5 min walk from Victoria station. We did not have breakfast at this place as I was quite concerned re: hygiene due to the state of the place. I would not stay here again and would not reccomend it either unless some serious renovations go into the place

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: JennZen
Reviews.Content: my husband and I stayed here for 2 nights and i couldn't wait to get out of there!! the staff was not very nice...we had to leave our hotel key at the front desk everytime we left the hotel (which i'm not sure if this is common in Europe hotels, but i didn't like this idea cuz anyone could go into our room)...there was no elevator and our room was on the 3rd floor, and the room is extremely tiny!!!! the bed was very uncomfortable and for some reason i kept getting itchy from the sheets every night...the pillows had to be old and worn down because i felt like i wasn't even sleeping on a nice fluffy pillow, and the bathroom...that had to be the worst!!!! so tiny and the shower had this nasty musty odor...i think it was coming from the old shower curtain that probably hadn't been changed since who knows when!! the room had no iron so i had to borrow it from downstairs, and the guy wouldn't even bring up the ironing board for me...so i had to carry the heavy thing up 3 flights of stairs!! the lady serving us breakfast didn't even smile, say hello, and was just unpleasant. the only good thing about this place is the location...close to the Victoria station and near restaurants...however, there were other parts of London that seemed a lot more lively...this location seemed a little more dead. if i ever come back to London, i will NOT be staying at this hotel...and you shouldn't either!!

Reviews.Title: “More like 3.5/5”
Reviews.Author: glecoq
Reviews.Content: We checked in here as an emergency replacement from our hated hostel. Our first impressions: very nice neighborhood and located about 5 minutes away from Victoria station, extremely friendly and helpful staff, and a clean lobby. Our room was on the ground floor and cost 65 pounds/nt. It was an extremely small room with a window that looks out towards...nothing, a somewhat uncomfortable bed, a tv, a sink that didn't drain properly, and a kettle. Overall, above average for the price. Bathroom was right outside our room and shared with--I think--three other rooms. One shower, a toilet, and a sink (which *did* drain properly!). The bathroom was clean and there was hot water every time we showered. Breakfast was included, but we decided to eat elsewhere. Overall, I would recommend this place, particularly in the off-season when prices drop to 50-55, I believe. The area is great: right next to the station and an easy, 15 minute walk to Buckingham Palace...and another 10 to Parliament--we walked everywhere and felt very comfortable walking back to the hotel at night. Staff was very helpful and allowed for luggage storage for a few hours after checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly People & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: angelat33
Reviews.Content: The Jubilee was great for the value. Paying 55 pounds a night for this ideal location and great breakfast was great. Yes, the room was downstairs and very tiny but it did the job. Bathrooms clean and we really couldn't beat the location. Only 2 blocks from Victoria station we could easily hop on the tube and easily caught the bus for our day trip to Stonehenge. I would stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location & Spartan accommodations at economical rate”
Reviews.Author: Mike_WR_GA
Reviews.Content: Located on the beautiful Eccleston Square, Jubilee is within a 5 minute walk to Victoria Station â€“ a major gateway to the rest of London with buses, coaches, and the Tube. The very economical rate (at least for London) of Â£79 per night provides a Spartan well-worn en suite double room though clean and tidy. Three flights of stairs and no lift separated our room from the front door which would be a challenge for those with physical limitations. Hetul at the front desk was very helpful and accommodating. The morning breakfast is Spartan as well but edible with cereal, toast, jam, yogurt, OJ, and coffee/tea. London was very warm (82Â°F / 28Â°C) when we visited. The hotel is not air conditioned and the rooms do not have fans. Sleeping was a challenge until past 11 pm when the room cooled somewhat via the raised window. Donâ€™t expect 4/5 star accommodations at a 1 star rate.

Reviews.Title: “Service !Q!!”
Reviews.Author: ThePinkPanther2001
Reviews.Content: Service unknown, nobody at the reception to help, was alone with heavy suitcase - nobody gave me a hand, tried to get a phonecall at 21:30, nobody at the reception, asked for a possibility to put somethin in a fridge - no way possible.They say there is Wlan available, yes, but what a pricetag! Ok, the amount I have to pay is reasonable - but a little bit of service or only a person at the reception which is nice would be a great advantage. Like this I say STAY AWAY - lousy service

Reviews.Title: “It's cheap and the location is great, but you get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: mapglobal2
Reviews.Content: Years ago I stayed here as a broke undergrad student, and on a spur of the moment trip back to London, I thought it would be interesting to experience it again years later from a totally different perspective. Basically, itâ€™s a bare boned B&B in the classic London tradition. I stayed here for three nights from 18 July, 2011onward. My en-suite room was very basic, but reasonably clean. You can get a cheaper room with shared bath, but after having stuck my head into the shared bathroom on one floor, I wouldnâ€™t recommend that route, unless you economically absolutely have to. The building has no lifts, so keep that in mind. If you end up on the 5th floor, like I was, youâ€™ll be huffing and puffing getting your things up and down. They do serve breakfast, but I did not sample it during my stay, so canâ€™t comment on it. There is wireless, at a reasonable cost, with a strong signal, so no weak drop-out problems, as is often the case with budget places. The best thing about this place is the Location, which is about 3-4 minâ€™s walk from Victoria Station. The other positive is the price. London is a hotel city, but the days of getting dirt cheap places are long over. Even â€˜budgetâ€™ places are pricey. Jubilee, and places in that immediate area, (Hugh St, Belgrave Rd, etc), is still your best bet for affordable accommodations. I was here only for a few days exclusively to check out West End theatre (see my review on one of them; Wicked), the London Museum, and some shopping at Harrods, so I didnâ€™t spend a lot of time in the room. Will I stay here again? Likely not, as this was kind of a sentimental stay reliving some old memories, but if youâ€™re looking for a cheap place thatâ€™s reasonably clean, then go for it. Overall I think it is one of the better B&Bâ€™s in that area, but you do get what you pay for. You also might want to try Comfort Inn, which a few seconds walk away, if you want this area but with more modern facilities. Cost will be about 50% more than Jubilee. Likely Iâ€™ll try there on my next visit to London.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel at a good location.”
Reviews.Author: EKC2011
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because of its location. With the price we paid during the Royal Wedding period, I think it has offered the best. Yes, the room was small but it was tidy and clean enough. The breakfast was good also. I would have no complain.

Reviews.Title: “look for a better hotel than this one”
Reviews.Author: lily528807
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel february 2011 the bedroom was on the top floor with no lift and 85 stairs to climb up and down every day the bedroom was very small with nowhere to put your belongings. The whole place could do with a compleat makeover. Breakfast is cereal and cold toast with a pot of cheap yogurt . Tea is served in a heated flask wich is pored into you cup at the table. Teapots milk and suger on your table are non existant. I would never stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Had a nice time staying in hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sourabh315
Reviews.Content: I had a nice time staying in hotel. All the facilities provided are excellent. I would like to give one suggestion regarding the breakfast that it can be different on different days of the week. It would be good for people staying for many days in hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A bare bones, but perfectly okay place to stay for a weekend in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: oliviamarion
Reviews.Content: We weren't expecting much due to other reviews we had read, but when we arrived we were pleased that the rooms weren't quite as bad as everyone had made them out to be. Yes, there is some rust and burning here and there (we brought our own sheet and pillow case) and yes our door was cut at the bottom slanted at an odd angle so our toes could fit under it, but the basic services are provided, along with a bare bones breakfast service, and for New Year's weekend which is what we booked it for, it's an average type hotel that will have some feeling homesick but some (more reasonable) folks feeling just fine about their stay.

Reviews.Title: “YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR”
Reviews.Author: ILiveForMyVacation
Reviews.Content: I stayed there in June 2010 for 2 days. Got Room 7 in the basement. Terrible experience. Washroom(toilet) and shower is filthy. Since it was in the basement, it feels humid and it was cold for a July. The mattress was not comfortable to sleep on. There was a big hole in the small bed as i believe the spring got busted in the middle. The shower is small and you dont want this curtain to touch your body while showering. The curtain does not seem to be clean. When you take a shower, there are no hangers to put your clothes. The only place you can put it is on the toilet cover. When you are sitting to take a dump, you would want to close your eyes. If your eyes are open, do not look below the washbasin. It was full of other people hairs and you can see the wood below the shower being eaten by moisture. Not a pleasant sight. Just pray for your dump to be quick and swift so that you can get out of this. On the wall in your bedroom, you can see other people footprints. I guess they put their feet up when they were sleeping or relaxing. The carpet is red and seems to be well vacuumed... until you look next to under your bed. There are full of dirts and hairs. Forget about breakfast. Once we had a look, we did not want to eat it. Toast does not look eatable. Only bright spot from this hotel is it is only 5 mins from vicotria station. So you can hop on a coach to stansted/gatwick or take the underground easily. And I can bet you that you will want to be relieved to be in the coach once you left Jubilee Hotel. I was.

Reviews.Title: “What you see is what you get”
Reviews.Author: A_Gzzle
Reviews.Content: I've passed here 3 nights on a solo travel on a budget in London. I had no particular expectations about my accomodation in general, and specifically about this hotel. All I wanted was basically a bed in a decent room and a toilet/shower. That's what I got. On the plus side: location: the place is in a nice square within 3 minutes walking from Victoria tube, bus and coach station. On the minus side: my room was on third floor (no elevator), breakfast is toasted bread with jam/marmalade. Final grade: poor to average

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it.”
Reviews.Author: MississippiStylist
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nites because my usual London hotel was fully booked. I have lived in England for 38 years and USA for almost 30 years, stayed in many hotels in both countries. This place is cheap by London standards, the location is good , but that's all it has going for it. Rooms are miniature even by London standards, bathroom was impossibly small, room was worn, no wardrobe just 4 coat hooks above the bed. Miniature TV did not work, coffee pot semi exploded. No elevator so carry your bags up 4 flights of stairs if you are up there. Breakfast was adequate for continental style. If you go alone you can make it for 2 days, if you take the wife be prepared for her to file the divorce papers. There are dozens of small hotels in this area, check out the reviews carefully, you must be able to do better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for a few days in London”
Reviews.Author: kedi007
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, the shared bathrooms too. The bathrooms are tiny but that's what you expect in the centre of London. The sheets are not changed daily, don't expect 5-star-hotel service. Perfect location, next to Victoria station and a 20-minute-walk from Buckingham palace and the Parliament Family-owned hotel with staff who do not smile a lot but are helpful Breakfast was awful for someone who wants a healthy diet: all carbohydrates, wouldn't recommend it for a longer stay As a whole, for the money you pay, you get a decent hotel. Compared to other hotels in the area, it is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “I felt like committing suicide after one night in this dump”
Reviews.Author: MichaelWLancashire
Reviews.Content: The hotel I was booked into double booked and I ended up in the Jubilee at the last minute. It really is the most depressing place I have ever stayed in. In all fairness it isn't dirty but just depressingly shabby. Cigarette burns were the main feature of the room. The curtains had burns, the shower had rust in every corner, the lavatory had burns every where and a few rather suspicious looking unpleasant marks. The breakfast is so bad it is almost funny. A cup of cold tea, when I asked for a hot one the waiter reluctantly offered to put it in a microwave. A yoghurt, followed by some toast , but I was afraid to use the marmalade or jam because of the amount of debris in the dishes. The staff are downright rude, and the whole feel of the place utterly unpleasant. It is truly to be avoided unless you are totally desperate.

Reviews.Title: “cheap but they don't smile”
Reviews.Author: sirr
Reviews.Content: This hotel is cheap, but they don't smile. unless you're ok with this, find other hotels. location wise, it is not far from Victoria station, so no worries if you have to carry or drag your luggage. Additionally, if you go to this hotel, bearing in mind the price you pay, please expect the following: 1. Small room 2. Small shower & toilet 3. Toasted bread as breakfast

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel in the World”
Reviews.Author: punditnearyou
Reviews.Content: Certainly the worst I have ever stayed in. The rooms are disgustingly filthy, small, and damp. Things are broken. There are mice and rats. The staff are unbelievably, offensively rude. They will ring you at 8am and demand to know if you're coming to breakfast. They will shout at you for no reason. They only take payment in cash which makes me think they are - at the very least - defrauding the Inland Revenue. It is a vile, nasty place and there are much better, equally cheap alternatives. ABSOLUTELY AVOID.

Reviews.Title: “Pick a neihbouring hotel”
Reviews.Author: sasy_smile
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean enough. The boys at reception are very helpfull. However the breakfast is a joke. For piece of toast you will wait quite a bit. We stayed three nights and for this time the towels weren't changed once. The shared bathroom and toilet is 1x2 meters so you can imagine how small it is and is crying for new paint and shower curtain. On the day of departure we requested wake up call which we never got. So make sure if you travel early you get your own alarm. On the next street there are at least 10 other hotel, which for the same money offer much better service and accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: npigas
Reviews.Content: It is very near to Victoria Station. Small rooms, but helpful stuff. Plain breakfast. Value for money regarding the location.

Reviews.Title: “paper thin walls and is London really that expensive???”
Reviews.Author: Pinkyracer
Reviews.Content: It was clean enough, at least I couldn't find any bugs. The "in-suite bath" is actually a fiberglass unit for a boat or something. Which was amusing, but not 50 quid a night amusing. The room was charmingly small, they'd clearly carved up the house into as many tiny rooms as possible. The best part was the free wifi from the rich neighbors, as my room being at the back was a little too far for the hotel's router. They would only give me one towel, but hey, it was clean and nobody robbed me, so I guess for London that's all you can expect at this price. I'm trying a different one next time, but not expecting anything better for this price range. I had to wear earplugs even while awake in my room as the high-def details of my neighbor's cough were too disgusting to bear.

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Return”
Reviews.Author: granbranfan
Reviews.Content: Plus 1: I got down late for breakfast on my first morning. The manager was very nice and organized a late breakfast for me. He was very nice and friendly at that time. Plus 2: I complained about my small room, and for the same price, I was moved to a bigger room a couple of days later. They did not seem keen on the idea of me checking out early. Plus 3: The hotel was very warm. They did not skimp on the heating which was great. Plus 4: The breakfast was very nice. Always a nice hot cuppa tea. They used real china and the service was prompt and attentive. It was awkward sharing a table with total strangers but it was either that or go hungry. Minus 1: My room was very narrow and the bathroom was very cramped in a cupboard in which I had to step up in order to get onto the toilet. The basin had nasty chips and was unhygienic looking. Minus 2: The bed was comfy but the pillow was not! I had to use my clothes as a pillow. However, when I changed rooms, the next pillow was comfortable. Minus 3: The attitude of the male staff seemed to change after my complaint about the small room and bathroom. They seemed to become cold and unfriendly. I would not stay here again but the location near Victoria was great. The Comfort Inn is closer still to Victoria and if I were ever to stay in this part of London again, I would choose the Comfort Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Sufficient. Not flashy, not horrible.”
Reviews.Author: cinewoman
Reviews.Content: This is a mediocre, yet safe, few- steps- up- from a Hostel in a pleasant neighborhood of London. Conveniently short walk to the main subway stop, Victoria Station. With the exception of the kind and helpful manager, the rest of the staff appears stand-offish and uninterested in customer service, though this may be more of a communication or translation problem because most of them do not speak English. The room is indeed small, and certainly not the cleanest room you'll ever stay in but sufficient for those who intend to spend their time out and about rather than lounging in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “jubilee hotel--friendly and close to victoria”
Reviews.Author: bobeff
Reviews.Content: we needed a good hotel for a couple of decompression nights in london after a week in italy and one in lancashire--before our gatwick-ft lauderdale flight back home: jubilee hotel was perfect! 2 + 1/2 blocks from victoria station (train & tube) and run by a very solicitous family--bevan (sp?) patel even made sure his new ice machine was available for our 2-night stay! the room and "en-suite" were small but clean and very quiet--perfect for our brief re-encounter with the charms of this vibrant city...

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Brownswede
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant stay at Jubilee hotel. The rooms were small but clean and so was the bathroom, which for us is very important. We had a room at the top (4th) floor and there was no elevator. For us that was no problem, just a bit of extra exercise. Breakfast was as you could expect, no abundance but rather acceptable. The location next to Victoria coach station was just perfect for us as our flight from London was very early in the morning and we were able to walk to the bus stop in just a few minutes. I have stayed in several hotels and hostels and there has been some much worse than the Jubilee. Itâ€™s a no frills accommodation but very nice for the price you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid!!”
Reviews.Author: VineshChauhan
Reviews.Content: Hotel - Rooms are small and clean - Bathroom is very small. The shared bathroom is bigger than en-suite - I found the manager very moody. He does not like to talk a lot. Evening staff was very nice and interacts with guests. Eating out What ever you do avoid Spicy World indian restaurant (5 mins away from the hotel). If you do go there, avoid the chef specials!! Food is bland and looks like dogs dinner. To sum up, I would avoid this hotel and find another budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small but adequate”
Reviews.Author: chipinoh
Reviews.Content: I booked on the basis of Rick Steves' review. I had the opportunity to speak with him on a call-in radio show prior to leaving & I told him I was risking my marital bliss based on his guidebook. I ended up having to move my reservation by two weeks, which the hotel handled without a problem. Upon arrival, the hotel had a plumbing issue in one of the rooms, so my wife and I spent our first night in room 35. It was so small that the bed could only be exited on one side - all three other sides abutted a wall. The shower was approximately 2' x 2' x 6'6". There was a hand-held shower head, but I still found it nearly impossible to wash thoroughly. The bed, supposedly a double, was really more like a twin-&-a-half. The room was clean (other than a cigarette burn in the bedspread), but it was really so small as to be laughable. I've stayed at the Upper West Side YMCA in NYC; this room was smaller. I'm sure they don't normally put two people in this room (especially two fat Americans!) because there was only one towel in the room. Breakfast was toast, cereal, yogurt, juice & coffee. Not great, but adequate and served with a smile. As we were leaving for the day, the manager let us know that they'd be moving us to another room. We told him that our junk was kinda unpacked, but he told us they'd be happy to organize our stuff & move it for us. We were hesitant, but we agreed. Upon our return, we found our bags had been repacked with care & transplanted to room G1 on the ground floor. The room was such a vast improvement that we nearly cried. It was still small by American standards, but there was a desk, a closet, hangers, & a bathroom that, while still small, was big enough to use. We couldn't have been more thrilled. The rest of our stay was quite pleasant. The desk staff was helpful & polite, although the night manager (a woman) seemed somewhat disapproving when my wife & I returned separately & an hour apart one night. At checkout, we had to produce our receipt from check-in to show that we really had paid in full in advance (per the hotel policy). They keep their records hand written in a book and the person who checked us in didn't write our payment down. Overall, our experience was pretty good. If circumstances allow, I'll probably pay a bit more & upgrade our hotel next time. If budget is an issue, I'd certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it!”
Reviews.Author: Cancersmash
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Jubilee immensely. Our room was small but quite clean. The bathroom was teeny-tiny but also quite clean and was actually in our hotel room so we didn't have to share with people we didn't know. They have computers for internet access which is convenient. They also stored our luggage for us until check in since we were a little early. We were confused on the breakfast time and came late the first morning and they grudgingly accomodated us. For the price and location we think it was an excellent value. If you are looking for cheap accomodation in London the Jubilee is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: rlower
Reviews.Content: Simple & clean place to stay. No frills or extras...but we didn't need it. Very close to Victoria Station (3 blocks), so very convenient to the transportation hubs.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: jazziebaggs
Reviews.Content: Hotel was ok. Great location and easy to find. The front desk staff were very accomadating. It was nice that they had a computer there for guests to use. Breakfasts could have been better. Rooms very small and not as clean as I would have liked. The bed was small for two adults and not very comfortable. The worst part was the noise from the neighbors. The walls very paper thin and you could hear everything. The last night a family with several members stayed in the room next to us and talked and jumped around until well after midnight and then was up at 4:30 am to leave.

HotelInfo.Name: Jubilee Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 31 Eccleston Sq, London SW1V 1NZ, England
